page.title: 12RELIGION IN THIS AREA(CONT)
page.content: boundaries extend up to Windmill and Morley. When the Bishop built the church, which was extended in 1867, he endowed the Church with approx. 90 acres of land. It is because of that endowment that the incumbent is called Rector and not Vicar. The first incumbent, George Watson, built a house for himself, and a farmhouse as well as a school for the village children. He lived at Etherley for 35 years. The present incumbent is the 14th Rector. From 1832 regular Sunday and weekday worship has been maintained. All who live in the Parish are entitled to be baptised, married and buried in and by the Church. The early Registers are now kept at County Hall, Durham. Burials have taken place in the churchyard since 1834 and
